name: Kowloon City Plaza
description: Kowloon City Plaza is a shopping centre located at Kowloon City, Kowloon, Hong Kong. It was established in 1993, and it underwent a HK$100-million renovation from October 2005 to December 2006. The shopping centre re-opened on 26 January 2007.

name: New Kowloon Plaza
address: 38 Tai Kok Tsui Road, Tai Kok Tsui
description: New Kowloon Plaza (English: New Kowloon Plaza ) is one of the medium-sized shopping malls in Yau Tsim Mong District , Hong Kong . It is located at No. 38 Tai Kok Tsui Road . The shopping mall is 2 floors high and 82,500 square feet. It was completed in 1989. Before Olympian City was built, it was the largest shopping mall in Tai Kok Tsui . The developer of New Kowloon Plaza is Sun Hung Kai Properties . Although the square is not close to the Olympic Station and Mong Kok Station , it is one of the earliest new commercial buildings. Although the name of New Kowloon Plaza contains the words (New Kowloon), its location does not fall within the scope of New Kowloon.

name: Festival Walk
description: Festival Walk is a shopping centre in Kowloon Tong, Hong Kong developed jointly by Swire Properties and CITIC Pacific between 1993 and 1998. At the time of its opening in November 1998, it was the biggest shopping mall in Hong Kong. Festival Walk is acquired by Mapletree North Asia Commercial Trust (MNACT). There are also four floors of offices on top of the mall.

name: Dragon Centre
address: 37K Yen Chow Street, Sham Shui Po District
description: Dragon Centre is a nine-storey shopping centre in the Sham Shui Po area of Kowloon, Hong Kong. It was the largest in West Kowloon until the Elements opened above the Kowloon MTR station.

name: Telford Plaza
address: 33 Wai Yip Street, Kowloon Bay, Kwun Tong District
description: Telford Plaza is a shopping mall in Kowloon Bay , Hong Kong , located below the MTR Headquarters Building , Hang Seng Center and Telford Gardens . Telford Plaza Properties is managed by the MTR Corporation . It was called Telford Mall from 1980 to '97, and Telford Plaza after 1997. It was divided into one phase and two phases. The first phase of the mall opened in 1980 and the second phase in 1997.

name: Yue Xiu Plaza
address: 3 Ning Yuen Street, San Po Kong
description: Yue Xiu Plaza, one of Hong Kong's shopping malls and housing estates , is located in the west of San Po Kong, Kowloon . It was opened in 1995 . The lower level of the entire building is a shopping mall, and there are two buildings on the upper level. It was formerly the largest theater in Hong Kong : The Palace Theatre.

name: Pacific Place
address: 88 Queensway, Admiralty and 1â€“3 Queen's Road East, Wan Chai
description: Pacific Place is a complex of office towers and hotels and a shopping centre situated at 88 Queensway, Admiralty, Hong Kong. The latest phase, Three Pacific Place, is located at 1 Queen's Road East, Wan Chai. The four-level shopping centre is home to over 160 shops and boutiques and one major department store. The complex is also home to three five-star hotels, a boutique hotel, three office towers and 270 serviced apartments, all of which are pet friendly.

name: LandMark
description: Landmark is a commercial complex owned by Hongkong Land in Central, Hong Kong. It consists of three office towers: Gloucester Tower, Edinburgh Tower and York House. Its retail podium, Landmark Atrium, forms the core component of the LANDMARK shopping mall. The Landmark Mandarin Oriental Hotel is in the lower floors of Edinburgh Tower, directly linked to the retail floors of Landmark Atrium.

name: Lee Tung Avenue
description: Lee Tung Avenue, formerly named Avenue Walk before its completion, is a shopping mall located at the base of Avenue Walk , 200 Queen's Road East, Wan Chai District, Hong Kong . The developer is Sino Land , Hopewell Properties and the Urban Renewal Authority , with Sino Land responsible for the mall management, the joint venture shares the net rental income in a 40:60 ratio. The mall opened to the public on November 28, 2015 , 8 years ago , and opened in 2016 The first quarter of the year officially opened.

name: Island Resort Mall
address: 28 Siu Sai Wan Road, Siu Sai Wan
description: Island Resort Mall is one of Hong Kong's medium-sized shopping malls, located at the base of the Island Resort Mall in Siu Sai Wan , Hong Kong . It opened in 2001 (23 years ago) and is developed and managed by Sino Land . The shopping mall is three floors tall and houses a variety of shops and restaurants.The mall used to have a market called_Montmartre_on the promenade on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, with various handicrafts and art performances, but it has been cancelled.
